usability_domain: A comparison of genome-wide expression profiles of Circulating Tumor Cells (CTCs) with matched primary tumors is assessed in the project.
Individual CTC genes are isolated from pancreatic CTCs through purification and selection methods.
Single cell RNA sequencing is performed on the CTC genes to create a CTC gene library.
CTC gene set processing, alignment and enrichment is done accessing and using various databases and tools.
This BCO pipeline was created based on the work of Ting et al. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.celrep.2014.08.029

Suppl_info.Description:: Supplemental information from the publication. It contains the BCO pipeline details (pages 4-6).

Git_repo.Description:: Github repository created to store some of the pipeline outputs as uri accessible.

pipeline_steps.name: Generation of Exon Positions
pipeline_steps.description: Provides alignment data for when no-novel-juncs argument is set with mouse genome mm9 and transcriptome defined by mm9 KnownGene Table. At the input UCSC uri provided, adjust the fields' dropdown menus to match the parameter values provided in the parametric domain for step 0. Top Hat uses the Bowtie tool to look at unmapped reads and align them according to splicing junctions. Bowtie was used in coordination with TopHat in order to align color space reads.

pipeline_steps.name: Generation of gene expression heatmap using Grid Graphics in R
pipeline_steps.description: Designed for the selection of desired genes for visualization, and for the assembly of the gene expression heatmap.

pipeline_steps.name: Determination of differential gene expression using Bioconductor Software
pipeline_steps.description: Determines the false discovery rate (FDR) estimates for up and down differential expression of the sequenced genes. Values for analysis are available in the parametric domain.

pipeline_steps.name: Gene set enrichment via ontological means of analysis

prerequisite.prerequisite description: this database is constructed with data from KEGG pathway, Gene Ontology Biological Process (GO_BP), Gene Ontology Cellular Component (GO_CC).
prerequisite.name: DAVID

uri.filename: Database for Annotation, Visualization, and Integrated, Discovery.

pipeline_steps.description: Provides a comprehensive set of annotation tools for functional interpretation of large lists of genes. The KEGG Pathway Integrated database used for biological interpretation of genome sequences and other high-throughput data. GO_BP is a Controlled vocabulary for classification of gene function and used to perform enrichment analysis for an independent biological process with a defined beginning and end. GO_CC is a Controlled vocabulary for classification of gene function and used to perform enrichment analysis for a cellular structure.

parametric_domain.param: Form expression units in reads per million (rpm) count
parametric_domain.value: divide gene count reads mapped to the gene by the total number of reads mapped at any gene, and multiply answer by one million.
Krt7, Krt8, Krt18, Krt19, Epcam, Egfr, Cdh1
Cdh5/Cd144, Vwf, Thbd/Cd141, Pecam1/Cd31, Mcam/Cd146, Sele/E-selectin, Cd34

parametric_domain.param: select these established hematopoietic markers from these publications (Bertolini et al., 2006; Strijbos et al., 2008)
parametric_domain.value: Ptprc/Cd45, Csf3r/Cd114, Cd14, Fcgr3/Cd16, Itga2b/Cd41, Itgb3/Cd61

parametric_domain.param: select for significantly expressed genes between groups
use following groups of genes for comparison
parametric_domain.value: CTC-c vs Primary Tumor Enriched Gene, Primary Tumor vs CTC-c Enriched Gene, CTC-plt vs CTC-c, CTC-pro vs CTC-c, Primary Tumor vs WBC, WBC vs Primary Tumor, CTC-c vs WBC, WBC vs CTC

parametric_domain.param: for KEGG analysis select terms with the following q-value
for GO_BP and GO_CC analysis select terms with the following q-value

uri.filename: GSE51372 - read counts for the RNA-sequenced pancreatic circulating tumor cells (CTCs) in mice
GSE51827 - Provides the raw data for breast cancer CTCs in humans
GSE51827 - read counts for the RNA-sequenced breast cancer CTCs in humans.

False Discovery Rate (FDR).description: For differential gene expression analysis using Bioconductor RankProd, the FDR parameter was set to (<0.01)
